syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: understand the relationship between logarithms and indices, and use the laws of logarithms (excluding change of base)
understand the definition and properties of eˣ and lnx, including their relationship as inverse functions and their graphs
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including knowledge of the graph of y = eᵏˣ for both positive and negative values of k.

learning_objectives.description: use logarithms to solve equations and inequalities in which the unknown appears in indices
use logarithms to transform a given relationship to linear form, and hence determine unknown constants by considering the gradient and/or intercept.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. y = kxⁿ gives lny = lnk + n lnx which is linear in lnx and lny. y = k(aˣ) gives lny = lnk + x lna which is linear in x and lny.
